sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not distributive over complement.
message_1: Let A = {1,2,3} and B = {2,4,6}. Find (A complement x B complement) union (A complement x B) and compare it with (A complement x (B complement union B)) union (A complement x (B intersect B complement)). Show that the result verifies the statement "The Cartesian product of two sets is not distributive over complement".
